subject: RE: EksoNR landing page
preview: @glen did you action the below? Thanks

action.text: Glen Tenorio assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body: @glen did you action the below? Thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Glen Tenorio

full_threads.body: @glen can you please make these updates? Cheers

Hi Heath,

Thanks for the landing page. We love it!

There are a few changes we would like:
For the main image of Ken in the banner can we replace it to below where he is looking up:
https://we.tl/t-DPCK0pYx1l <https://we.tl/t-DPCK0pYx1l>
Please also use this image next to “What are the benefits?”
For “What is EksoNR?” can we change the title to “Empower your Mobility”? Can we also split this section into two columns.


The first column is “Empower your Mobility” with the text under and on the right-hand side we have a heading called “Ideal Solutions for”.

The second column will look like this:

Ideal Solutions for:
Stroke
Complete spinal cord injuries at levels C7 and below
Incomplete spinal cord injuries
Acquired brain injury
Multiple sclerosis
Parkinson’s disease
Giullain-Barre syndrome

EksoNR is only suitable for people who fit certain body shapes, ability to weight bear, and health requirements. Please read our FAQs below for further detail.


As we scroll down to the “Who Can Access EksoNR?” heading. Can we replace this with the features as per below? We will have to shrink down the full-body image.



After this, we go into testimonials.

Please see below images of team:
https://we.tl/t-B7kDURxYAj <https://we.tl/t-B7kDURxYAj>

Can we also make the testimonial images slightly larger on the website? The images currently are quite small for testimonial section.

Exact names and quotes are below:
“EksoNR is a robotic exoskeleton specifically designed to be used in a rehabilitation setting to progress neurorehab patients so they can walk out of the device and back into their communities.’’ – Jason Redhead, Senior Physiotherapist
“For people with paralysis or lower limb weakness, EksoNR is a game changer that can progress your ability to stand and walk like never before.” – Natalie DiDonato, Physiotherapist
“Being the first in the country to have such amazing, new technology that can give us real-time measurements of someone’s walking pattern, we can actually give people more feedback and see them achieve their goals faster.” – Stephanie Mock, Physiotherapist

We have a few other changes in relation to body copy but I will finalise that myself once this is locked in.

Thanks so much,
Janina


JANINA HIPOLITO​
MARKETING SPECIALIST

Subject: Re: EksoNR landing page

Hey Guys,

The page is looking great! 😄

Just a suggestion currently the image under the features is quite large and for users to see all the hover options of the machine you have to scroll. Have you considered shrinking the size of the image so users can see the image without having to scroll?

Thanks
Brittnay

We are finalising the EksoNR brochure at the moment, so once that is approved I will be providing some feedback early next week to align the design to that.

I’ll also send through some quotes for testimonials etc.

Thank you,
Janina

Subject: RE: EksoNR landing page

Hi Brittany,

The landing page will be targeted to current and potential clients of Royal Rehab. It is available across different departments such as Community, RRPH, Spinal and Brain (also MetroRehab) so there are many ways we can go about linking this.

It is the EksoNR page on the EksoBionics website that is targeted to physiotherapists only:
https://eksobionics.com/eksonr/ <https://eksobionics.com/eksonr/>

Hope this clarifies things.

Thanks so much,
Janina

On 11 Jan 2021, at 11:19 am, Janina Hipolito <Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Heath and Brittany,

I hope you had a lovely Christmas and New Years!

I just wanted to touch base regarding the Ekso landing page. We will be going live with EksoNR on 8 February.

I have resent an updated version of the landing page contents (see attached). @Brittany <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>, can you please review the copy and anything additional you would recommend from a search perspective?
We have finalised all the images of Ekso and we are in the middle of finalising the video content. I will send you a separate e-mail@heath <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> with all the photos.
For video we have the following: an informative product-only video as well as two client story videos. The product-only video is expected to be finalised within the next two weeks, while the client story videos will be finished possibly by early February. I will send these once they are finalised.

My recommended next steps are:
BG to review copy and provide recommendations by 13/01.
JH to send through content as they come (images then video).
HM to create concepts for review with placeholder for outstanding content (video) 20/01.
JH, TM and BG to review and provide amendments.
Final landing page ready and live by 8 February.

As always, I am happy to be guided by both your recommendations on lay-out, flow etc once we get to concept stage. Please let me know if you guys have any questions or issues with timing etc.

Thanks so much,
Janina
